title: How Many Calories Are in a Slice of Bread?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a slice of bread, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per slice with easy tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Slice of Bread?
assumptions: Standard white sandwich bread slice (~28 g), untoasted, no spreads or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, brand, slice thickness, and ingredients; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of white bread contains about 79 calories and 15 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a slice of white bread?
faqs.a: About 79 kcal for a standard 28 g slice.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a slice of bread?
faqs.a: Typically 15 g of carbs per slice, mostly from refined flour in white bread.

faqs.q: Do different bread types affect calories per slice?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”whole wheat may have slightly more (around 80-90 kcal), while sourdough varies by recipe.

faqs.q: Is there protein in a slice of bread?
faqs.a: About 2.7 g per slice, higher in whole grain varieties.

faqs.q: How does toasting change calories in bread?
faqs.a: Toasting doesn't add calories, but added toppings like butter do (e.g., +34 kcal per tsp).
